snippet.textDisplay:
One of the best JRPGS I've played in the seventh generation. A very unique setting;  great characters;  top-notch voice acting (especially from Jansen); and a fantastic soundtrack. Easily deserves an A and I would highly recommend it.

The Thousand Year Dreams were VERY well-written and translated; I would have loved to get the actual physical book in my hands so I can read it.

This game is actually inspiring one of the characters I'm creating a story for. To live for a thousand years like Kaim...the character I'm writing about could barely handle two-hundred.
snippet.textOriginal:
One of the best JRPGS I've played in the seventh generation. A very unique setting;  great characters;  top-notch voice acting (especially from Jansen); and a fantastic soundtrack. Easily deserves an A and I would highly recommend it.

The Thousand Year Dreams were VERY well-written and translated; I would have loved to get the actual physical book in my hands so I can read it.

This game is actually inspiring one of the characters I'm creating a story for. To live for a thousand years like Kaim...the character I'm writing about could barely handle two-hundred.

snippet.textDisplay: Well I like to grind a lot that way I can kill enemies fairly easily at least. With the battles by the end of disc 2, they take around 5-7 minutes to beat if you get a big group of em, even exploiting their weaknesses.

snippet.textDisplay: @VGKing Is that really true? I was so completely overpowered in the later game that I never considered any one piece of equipment/resistance an essential for survival. Tactics usually prevail.
snippet.textOriginal: @VGKing Is that really true? I was so completely overpowered in the later game that I never considered any one piece of equipment/resistance an essential for survival. Tactics usually prevail.

snippet.textDisplay: @VGKing the game didn't force them on you though. When I played this game I considered the game itself the filler between the dreams. lol Every single one was so interesting and insightful, that it really is a shame if you skipped them.

snippet.textDisplay: My friend and I just played through/beat this game recently. The game really has an outstanding soundtrack, and of course, the story was fantastic as well! It really makes you ponder... to be immortal...

snippet.textDisplay: @SupraDarky I have to agree. The dream sequences in particular are so beautifully written that it brought me to tears.
snippet.textOriginal: @SupraDarky I have to agree. The dream sequences in particular are so beautifully written that it brought me to tears.

snippet.textDisplay: @HeavensMeat It wasn't that bad. I usually just look away or read an FAQ or a book or something, check my achievements as well or even reply to messages. I guess that's why it didn't bother me that much. There weren't only just 4 different kinds, it just seemed that way. A lot of jRPGs are like that anyway, only having six or seven, eight if we're lucky, different enemies in one area.
snippet.textOriginal: @HeavensMeat It wasn't that bad. I usually just look away or read an FAQ or a book or something, check my achievements as well or even reply to messages. snippet.textDisplay: I'm definitely going to get this game sometime soon, i've been putting it off for like 3 years :P
snippet.textOriginal: I'm definitely going to get this game sometime soon, i've been putting it off for like 3 years :P

snippet.textDisplay: My favorite JRPG of this generation so far that I've played. It actually felt like a mix of Final Fantasy and old school RPGs in general, with amazing music by Uematsu and nice story from Sakaguchi (with very memorable dream sequences that no one should skip). It's one of the few games where I actually felt some form of nostalgia while playing the game for the first time.
snippet.textOriginal: My favorite JRPG of this generation so far that I've played. It actually felt like a mix of Final Fantasy and old school RPGs in general, with amazing music by Uematsu and nice story from Sakaguchi (with very memorable dream sequences that no one should skip). It's one of the few games where I actually felt some form of nostalgia while playing the game for the first time.
